thread.title: Enter the Los Angeles News Group’s Halloween pet costume contest
thread.title_full: Enter the Los Angeles News Group’s Halloween pet costume contest

author: Samantha Valtierra Bush
title: Enter the Los Angeles News Group’s Halloween pet costume contest
text:
If you thought you were a “Back to the Future” super fan, think again because chances are, “ We’re Going Back ” has you beat.
The “Back to the Future” themed non-profit has a BTTF bonanza planned for the 30th anniversary of Back to the Future and the date characters time travel in “Back to the Future Part II.”
Starting Wednesday, the real Back to the Future Day, the group will kick-off five days of Back to the Future amazing-ness and people from around the globe are flying in to join in the festivities.
• Related: ‘Back to the Future’ will last forever. Here’s why
A large chunk of the events planned are shrouded in secrecy but some of the highlights include an exclusive Universal Studios back lot tour, a chance to ride a movie hoverboard (with the movie hoverboard rig), a bus tour of the Los Angeles area filming locations and a faithful recreation of the Enchantment Under the Sea dance at Hollywood United Methodist Church where the dance scenes were filmed.
• Related: What ‘Back to the Future’ got right about tech
Screenings of all three Back to the Future movies are planned on Oct. 21, 22 and 25. These too will be held at special locations like Universal Studios and the parking lot of the Puente Hills Mall.
We’re Going Back and the Puente Hills Mall are co-hosting a Back to the Future Fan Appreciation Day at the mall where the organization is already displaying movie memorabilia, Doc Brown’s DeLorean and his van, which is parked in the same parking spot it occupies in the movies.
Tickets for the full five days, just the Universal Studios tour and the Enchantment Under the Sea Dance are sold out but remaining tickets for the film location tour and the hoverboard day, which are going for $200 each, are still available.
All net proceeds from the events will go to the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research.
